headline: Perfect Pumpkin Pie
description: Smooth, creamy, and delicious, this easy pumpkin pie made with sweetened condensed milk makes the perfect ending to a Thanksgiving or Christmas feast.
name: Perfect Pumpkin Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND¬Æ Sweetened Condensed Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Whisk pumpkin puree, condensed milk, eggs, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and salt together in a medium bowl until smooth.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking until a knife inserted 1 inch from the crust comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Easy and delicious!!!
I've tried other recipes but I keep coming back to this one every year it doesn't have to be Thanksgiving or Christmas its good anytime!

I am a beginner pie maker and always shield away from making a pumpkin pie, mostly because I have always heard people rave about their Grandma's, Wife's, Mother in Laws, etc pumpkin pie. Holidays were usually celebrated at my house with me doing all the cooking, I would only ask that family/guests bring the pies. I made this recipe before Easter using fresh pumpkin puree that I made and tried it out on my friends, 6 out of 6 said it was the BEST they have had! The best part is that it was so EASY!! Thank you for this recipe, I no longer fear the Great Pumpkin Pie üëç
Yummy

I used 2 cups long island cheese pumpkin I had left from fall and fat free Sweetend condensed milk. The flavor was phenomenal. I made the mistake of tasting it right out of the oven, ended up having almost 2 pieces before it could cool down.
It had a nice taste, but the texture was off and a bit chunky, although it may have been my choice to make it in a pie maker.

Easy to make and tasty with adjustments. Too sweet, but can't control that with the condensed milk. I used condensed coconut milk since I'm lactose intolerant. I used a lot more cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger. I also added ground cloves and cardamom. Pumpkin pie & holiday dinners in U.S. need a lot more acid for the pallette. I added amchur, lemon peel and 2 T lime juice. A more sophisticated pie.
I made exactly according to directions and the pie turned out better than any other recipe I‚Äôve used. This is my new go to pumpkin pie recipe!
I added twice the cinnamon and used heavy cream instead of condensed milk, so I also added a cup of sugar and a tablespoon of honey for sweetness.
So easy to make and my family loved it!

I added cloves and more of the recommended spices. This pie has the best texture of any I‚Äôve made and it baked well. I‚Äôd definitely recommend it and I‚Äôm making another one today. It‚Äôs my husband‚Äôs favorite :)
Our favorite pumpkin pie recipe. We add extra pie spices, like ours a Lil more spicy...
I love this recipe, so easy to make and I love the taste.

I've been making this recipe for about 6 years on holidays. All my family and friends rave about this pie. I seen some negative reviews and am perplexed. Make sure you use the right ingredients a lot of those ingredients could easily be confused with similar looking ones. It will ballon out of the oven, then sink back down to a beautiful smooth finish while cooling. The condensed milk is very sweet so you don't have to add sugar, since condensed milk is made from cooking down milk with sugar all the sugar is there.
Taste just like Grandma and Mom used to make. Love it
A crowd pleaser every time. Very easy recipe to follow. Highly recommended. I do not understand the negative reviews. This tastes better than anything you can get in the store.

I LOVED this pie the first time I made it (took the rec to add more spices - 2tsp cinnamon and 2tsp pumpkin pie spice plus a splash of maple syrup). The second time the only thing I used different was the brand of condensed milk (first pie was Trader Joe‚Äôs, this one is Whole Foods) and it came out looking more the consistency of a pumpkin bread? Does anyone know why that might happen? It still tastes great so we are planning on eating it anyways.

It turned out perfect. If I were to make any change at all, it would be to add about 1/4 tsp of ground cloves or go the pumpkin pie spice route. For the commenters that didn't think it was sweet enough, my guess would be the long-running confusion between evaporated milk and sweetened condensed milk. Believe me, this pie is plenty sweet.
I made this according to recipe and baked in a pecan crust from Aldi's Perfect11

Best flavor and I loved the condensed milk so much more than before! I used a 9x13 - cut into squares. Before baking I brushed roasted pecan pieces soaked in fresh and cooked Fuji apple -tiny cubes.. My family raved over the flavor! Thank you and God Bless Eagle brand products!

Easiest recipe, great with a store bought graham cracker crust or homemade, you can easily adapt it- I add from a half to a whole block of room temp cream cheese whisked into the pumpkin first and add vanilla and I add a fair amount of extra spices but you can easily play around with the recipe. It cooked really fast- faster than most pumpkin pie recipes I‚Äôve tried and I found my oven at times over cooks the top some so cooking it lightly covered with foil helps it not get dark but still fully cook. It will look jiggly fresh out the oven and continue cooking at set as it cools. 10 stars if I could üëèüèª
I thought this was the absolute worst pumpkin pie I ever made. There is no ingredient in this pie to make the filling sweet.

It‚Äôs hard to screw up a pumpkin pie, but this recipe gave me that dubious honor. It wasn‚Äôt sweet (I even added a bit of brown sugar), even slightly salty (in a ‚ÄúI accidentally dipped it in seawater‚Äù kinda way), and blind baking the crust made it slightly tough. I ended up chucking it in the trash and making a quick cobbler to go with all those leftovers.

Classic. What's not to like? I've poured maple syrup on the bottom of the crust before putting in the pie mixture. Very nice. Sliced toasted almonds, Heath Toffee chips. They all taste good, but I like my Pumpkin Pie real.

My mom passed away this July. She has always made our pumpkin pies. Since she is no longer here, I attempted my first pumpkin pie. I followed this recipe to the letter and it came out PERFECT! I have one in the oven right now, as a matter of fact. Everyone loved it at Thanksgiving. I know my mom was smiling down. Thank you for this recipe, it's a keeper!

Used this recipe to bake two pies and out of curiosity used different cans of sweetened condensed milk in each one. I used the eagle brand and a generic one from a local grocery store. I found that the one baked with the generic sweetened condensed milk overpowered the pumpkin and was much sweeter. Say all this to say the brand of sweetened condensed milk you use matters. Loved this recipe and will be using it again.
Excellent recipe. Love the fact that it does not contain the over powering cloves. Smooth, creamy...a delicious pie like my mother and her mother made.

This is the first time I have made a pumpkin pie that was not Libby's Easy mix. Pie is in the oven right now. I have no idea how it will turn out. I accidentally used evaporated milk instead of the condensed. I added sugar so hopefully that will help. This recipe was easy to make. If it turns out bad then that is my fault and I will try it again. I like to cook but am not a baker even though my husband would like me to be!

I added a little extra spices and vanilla, but seriously! This pie was a hit at friendsgiving this year, everyone (who likes pie) loved it! Perfect firmness, doesnt fall apart when you lift the slices out of your pie dish. It really is a PERFECT pumpkin pie! Its so simple to make, I highly recommend it! This will be the ONLY pumpkin pie recipe we use in my house, forever! ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞

My first pie and first crust made from scratch! It was super easy to make. I didn't blind bake the crust either and it still came out great with the baking instructions. I also appreciated the insight to make sure the knife came out clean to make sure it was done. Just a solid pumpkin pie if you follow the instructions and just let it cool for a couple hours before digging in. Thanks so much!

Wow, so good! This was my first time making a pumpkin pie, and it came out perfectly. I added a couple more tablespoons cinnamon because I love it. All I had was cinnamon, ginger, and cloves and that was perfect. I read through the other reviews amd decided to add a splash of vanilla and about a tablespoon of brown sugar. I also pre-baked my crust for about 15 minutes with foil and rice holding it down. And then about 7 minutes with just the crust. 40 minutes was perfect for my oven. Like the recipe says, a knife should come out clean about an inch away from the crust, but the middle is pretty wiggly looking. After letting it cool it was the perfect consistency throughout. I'm definitely saving this recipe!
Since it was the first time I made it, I didn't change anything. It was a huge hit especially with cinnamon whipped cream on top.

Enjoying a piece as I write this review. I followed the recipe, including blind baking the crust, almost exactly. Only added a half cup of sugar after reading the comments. This will be my go-to recipe from now on!
Best pie love this recipe.
Worst recipe every. Very bland. They forgot to add the clove and sugar. Don't waste your ingredients.
Yum ! Really easy and great results ! crowd favorite!
This recipe was fantastic!!! I was in charge of desserts this year and my pumpkin pie lasted about 5 minutes. Everyone raved about it. Very simple to make with just the perfect flavors. Delicious!!!
Came out perfect!

I have made this recipe for the last two years. So easy to follow and prep time is fast. My family gets upset if I don't make the pumpkin pies for the holiday's!!! the only I do change is I use pumpkin spice instead of the individual spice's. I put in 3 tbls of pumpkin spice . You can use only 2 tbls, I just like spice.
Delicious pie. I reduced the sweetened condensed milk by half and the pie turned out great.
By far my favorite recipe, and I‚Äôve tried them all just about! followed the directions and it turned out perfect, thank you so much I‚Äôve been needing a great pumpkin pie recipe and now I have one
I decided to roast my own pumpkin‚Ä¶ so glad I did. Made the traditional Crisco crust. I always add a touch of sugar to my crust.
Very easy and not a lot ingredients. Condensed milk gives a very smooth texture and delicious taste.
This recipe is fabulous! The only thing I do differently is I add more brown sugar and vanilla.
I have made this recipe many times and it always turns out perfect! It is my go to recipe for Pumpkin Pie. I am always asked to bring the pie!

Came out perfect, followed recipe exactly, no issues at all. I had a lot of pumpkin and some deep dish crusts left so made one more, used the recipe, but in addition added 1/2 can pumpkin and an extra egg, little bit of extra ginger and cinnamon and it filled the deep dish crust perfectly. Came out beautiful except where I stuck my knife in to check if it was done. Some whipped cream will hide that with no issues.
Loved this recipe. Added a tiny bit of cloves and vanilla extract to mine, it came out wonderfully.

I don't know why everyone that likes the Libbys recipe is complaining. It's literally the same recipe, except 2 ingredients are combined into one product in this one. Sugar and evaporated milk=sweetened condensed milk. And if you want to avoid the Shar pei effect/ top bubbles, watch your freakin pie. All ovens are NOT created equally therefore time and temperature MAY NEED TO BE ADJUSTED, FOR ANY AND ALL RECIPES. ... NOT just this one. Are any of y'all bakers?
I make this pumpkin pie every year. It is super easy and not too sweet for me the perfect balance. I'm making it right now for our Thanksgiving Dinner tomorrow.
I do not understand how this recipe has 5 stars, because it‚Äôs easy? I think the Libby pumpkin pie version is better.
Amazing

This has become my "go-to" recipe for pumpkin pie. I add a little allspice to mine, and I do blind bake the crust for 8 to 10 minutes. Recommend for anyone who wants an easy pie recipe. Great for younger people, or new bakers.

Edit: I have been making this recipe for over 20 years now. It doubles easily for those big 29 oz cans of pumpkin. I‚Äôve also roasted and used pie pumpkins many times with great results. I have never needed to tweak the filling, and every time I have made it people have loved it. My husband doesn‚Äôt even like to try other pumpkin pies anymore! One thing I do now: rather than make my own crust (which I used to do) or buy a regular crust, I get a graham cracker crust! If I use a 29oz can of pumpkin, I can get one 9‚Äù and one 10‚Äù graham cracker crust and it‚Äôs perfect! One more tip: I always make my own whipped cream! So simple, can be done with heavy whipping cream, whipping cream, or coconut cream. I mix about a Tbsp sugar with a Tbsp cream, then pour in 1 1/2-2 cups heavy whipping cream and either whisk or use a mixer until nice peaks form. üëçüèº Chilling the bowl and the whisks beforehand speeds up the process, especially helpful if you are whisking by hand. Original 2006 review after I had been using this recipe for 6 years: I've used this recipe countless times with a homemade crust, and every time it's amazing! Thanks so much!

This came out perfect! The only thing I changed was I put in two teaspoons of pumpkin pie spice and one and a half teaspoons of cinnamon. I got rave reviews for the pie from all my co-workers. I'll definitely make this again!
Family loved it

I'm a cook not a baker and this is the first pumpkin pie I've made. I would give this recipe six stars. Really easy, quick and my family barely let the first one cool. Had to practice for the big day coming up and this recipe was the first I tried and I will never have to look up another recipe for pumpkin pie again. One and done baby. If you had something bad to say about this recipe, you did something wrong.
The crust was too flaky and the filling was rock-hard.
I made this recipe last year for the first time and will be making it again this year! I love all of the spices and it's perfect in my book! Thank you!
It's a good recipe and can be easily adjusted. I added pumpkin spice and a little more of the listed spices. It turned out great.
Delicious and easy to make.
I thought it needed pumpkin pie spice, but other than that, it was good. Especially topped with whipped cream! Yum!
Lots of cooking time.
Easy recipe, but not sweet enough ( I used sweetened condensed milk the recipe called for). Next time I will add sugar and up the spices a bit.
I followed this recipe exactly, I cannot taste the spices at all ! Very bland !
Great and easy recipe - texture in particular is excellent

Easy, quick and delicious. Family loves it every time, even my husband who doesn‚Äôt typically like anything pumpkin. I didn‚Äôt cook it as long as recipe calls for. Took it out when the sides swelled up and just slightly cracked. Middle was still a little wobbly but as it cooled off, it was creamy and perfect.

My crowd loved it! I made it with fresh pumpkin puree. I made sure to drain the puree in cheesecloth to make sure most of the water was out of the pumpkin so it would have the consistency close to the canned kind.
easy as pie ha ha, good flavor.

I used a store bought crust, and this turned out to be one of the easiest pies I‚Äôve ever made, ranking right up there with one of the tastiest, as well. The filling set up beautifully, no cracks on the top, creamy, and bursting with pure pumpkin flavor. What more could one want? It really was just about PERFECT.
Perfect for limited time event. Hit with everyone
I have used this recipe for years and always have a perfect pie!!! I do add a few extras. A 1/4 tsp of allspice & 1 tsp vanilla Making homemade whipped cream tops it perfectly
Best recipe I've ever tried! We enjoyed it! We used real pumpkin instead of the canned pumpkin puree. Will definitely keep this recipe.

I followed the recipe, and this did not taste or look like pumpkin pie. The only difference was I used fresh pumpkin and not canned pumpkin, but it said before the recipe that could be used. It was sweet enough, but it was soggy and it seemed like the ingredients did not mix together, and I left it mixing for a while. I made this recipe last year and swore I wouldn‚Äôt make it again, but I forgot about that until I saw how the mixture of ingredients looked and suddenly remembered it was this recipe. Leaving a review so I will remember next year to stay away from this one.

I have used this recipe for years and it turns out great every time. Everyone loves it! To those who are leaving reviews that it was bland and needs sugar: Make sure you are using condensed sweetened milk and not evaporated milk. There is a world of difference between the two.
I followed the directions perfectly but it never firmed up. Any idea what the problem may be?
This recipe is so easy to make and with such an amazing turnout! Definitely will recommend it! I tried adding a pinch of sugar and it rly made the taste pop!
Phenomenal pumpkin pie recipe, as good as I‚Äôve ever made! So easy as well, definitely found my new go to recipe!
Definitely easy to make with plain canned pumpkin. I felt the ginger was too strong and would reduce or eliminate it next time. Otherwise the texture was perfect.
Made this pie with a group of 8 year olds at church and all the pies turned out perfect! Definitely recommend. It‚Äôs fool proof!
Best I've had since my Mom's which hers was the best! I do believe that using fresh pumpkin is even better, it makes the pie more creamier and fluffy. Didn't alter the recipe at all.
I did it very much as the recipe directed, but used fresh ground nutmeg - same amount more or less, and freshly grated ginger, about 1 tablespoon. All the Thanksgiving guests raved about it.
Very easy to make
Simply the best pumpkin pie recipe! So easy, and comes out perfect every time!! The only thing I change is that I add a tiny bit more spice to mine.
My favourite pumpkin pie recipe! I do add just a pinch of ground cloves for abit more spice, as this recipe is pretty mild!
BEST pie recipe, hands down. I do use mcCormick pumpkin pie spice and cinnamon for the seasonings. Riker hey papa come here baby come here come here.
Probably the easiest recipe ever. Even with my own crust and own pumpkin puree. Several reviews said it wasn't sweet enough/too sweet but honestly it was just right.

I love the simplicity of this recipe. It's so versatile I use it to make my white pumpkin pie and my mock pumpkin pie (aka) butternut squash pie which no one can tell it's not a pumpkin pie. I love that this recipe doesn't add any more sugar than the already diabetic inducing sweetened condensed milk. I prefer pies in Europe since they aren't cloyingly sweet like American pies.
It was easy to follow and I found the thing were you could check off your ingredients helpful
Very easy to make; I had all of the ingredients in my pantry! Smelled amazing.

I followed this recipe to a T and it turned out really good! I had never made pumpkin pie but I do bake a lot of other things, and I can still definitely say this recipe was incrediblyyyy easy to make; my mom even questioned me as I was making it because it seemed too simple lol. Definitely fool proof. I followed recipe and cooking instructions 100% and here‚Äôs what I‚Äôll say; personally I used a store bought pie crust and did not bake it ahead of time, and it worked totally fine. Also, after I had reduced the temp down to 350¬∞, I let it cook for 35 mins and when testing with a knife, it came out completely clean. I read that some other people had soggy crust, and while I didn‚Äôt have that happen, I could see how it would be an issue for homemade crust, so watch out for that. All in all the cooking instructions worked great for me and I wouldn‚Äôt change them if I made it again. The pie also has an incredible, smooth texture, even days later. The only thing, however, that I WOULD change, is instead of adding the ginger, I would add allspice. I‚Äôm not a huge fan of ginger, and it definitely is a flavour that comes through quite strong, so if you like that, I would leave the recipe as is or you could even add more potentially, but if not, I would substitute for allspice, Chinese five spice or forget it all together. Nonetheless, I still really enjoyed this pie and it wasn‚Äôt too incredibly overwhelming, just a note that I noticed and didn‚Äôt love. Definitely serve her up with loads of whipped cream and I‚Äôm sure all your guests will love it!
It is the creamiest pumpkin pie recipe I‚Äôve ever tried! Absolutely delicious!

I made this with the suggestion to substitute the spices for 2 tsp of pumpkin pie spice and 1 tsp of cinnamon. I also tented the pie with aluminum foil. It cooked perfectly, but it was rather bland, not because of the lack of spices, but it severely lacked in sweetness. I definitely used sweetened condensed milk, and the same amount as described in the recipe. Because it technically came out so well, I might try this again, but with an added quarter cup of brown sugar and maybe even an additional quarter cup of granulated sugar to taste. I don't even love overly sweet dishes, but it truly was that bland imo. The sweetened condensed milk simply didn't give it enough of a push.

I totally followed the recipe. Never once did I think there was anything wrong with it. I made it for my daughter and her family for dinner and she asked me what kind of pie I made. I told her pumpkin pie and she said it didn‚Äôt taste like pumpkin pie. I did put one slice aside for myself and I tried it and it was terrible. Never did I think that the recipe did not have sugar in it and it tasted terrible.
I followed this recipie I love it Never used sweetened condinst milk before so I shall see
Made 2 because I didn‚Äôt know how big those crust where. Will try them when I come home after work.
It tasted amazing. I didn't change anything. üòã
It was easy, quick and yummy !

Pumpkin pie, oh pumpkin pie, how I love you pumpkin pie. Your cinnamon spice is oh, so nice. I search in haste to find that taste. You fill my night with lots of delight. You are a great treat that can‚Äôt be beat. I wish this night won‚Äôt ever end, because you are like my best friend. Your sweet aroma is so amazing, now I feel my heart‚Äôs a-blazing. You have a taste I can‚Äôt deny, that‚Äôs why I love you pumpkin pie.

I too had a soggy bottom. I also used McCormick pumpkin pie spice, and wish I added cinnamon. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't fabulous either. It is a good jumping off point, but I agree that a blind bake might help.
